Question: You may park your vehicle on a loading zone when:

Answers.Answer: you are loading or unloading people or goods
there is no other vehicle on it
it is between the hours of 12am and 6am
it is between the hours of 6pm and 6am

Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What are you NOT allowed to do when driving on a motorway?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you have a rear tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: What is the maximum distance a load may overhang your vehicle behind the rear axle?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When you have a learner licence you do not have to have it with you when you drive if your supervisor has their licence with them.
If you are going straight through a roundabout don’t signal as you come up to the roundabout, only signal left as you pass the exit before the one you wish to take.
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: A rest area is 70 metres ahead
Do not stop for the next 70 metres

Question: What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: When coming up to a one-lane bridge, what does this sign indicate?

Answers.Answer: Others should give way to you

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You look in the mirror and see a cyclist – what should you do when opening the car door?

Answers.Answer: Open the door and expect the cyclist to stop
Open the door and expect the cyclist to swerve
Wait for the cyclist to go past before opening the door
Warn the cyclist by sounding the horn before opening the door

Question: The 100km/h speed limit sign shown is the minimum speed you are allowed to drive in good conditions.
When driving into bright sunlight, you should use sunglasses and your vehicle sun visors for safety. What else are you advised to do?

Answers.Answer: Turn the headlights of your vehicle on
Drive safely on the far left of the road
Look at and drive close to the centre of the road
Pull over or stop and wait for a few minutes

Question: What does this marking mean?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is the maximum speed you may drive if you have a ‘space saver wheel’ fitted?
What must you do at an intersection controlled by a Stop sign?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop
Stop only if you can do so safely
Continue driving unless you can see an oncoming vehicle

Question: You are waiting at a railway level crossing and the red lights continue to flash after the train has passed. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive on carefully while the lights are still flashing
Stay stopped until the lights stop flashing
Check both ways and then drive on
Wait for 15 seconds and then drive on

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.
If you are under 20, which statement is correct?

Answers.Answer: You are not permitted to drink any alcohol before driving
You may drink two standard glasses of alcohol
You may drink one standard glass of alcohol
There are no restrictions on limits of alcohol but you are not able to drive if intoxicated

Question: If you are turning left at an intersection, you must give way to vehicles coming towards you that are turning right.
What does a reflectorised triangle placed on the side of the road mean?
For what purpose can a vehicle use the flush median strip?

Answers.Answer: To move into the traffic flow

Question: Before any modification is carried out on your vehicle, you should:

Answers.Answer: remove the registration plates from your vehicle
check with an authorised vehicle inspection centre
check that your warrant of fitness is current to within 1 month
record the modification on your vehicle ownership papers

Question: In addition to checking it is safe to move out from the kerb into the traffic flow, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Accelerate quickly into the traffic flow
Move slowly into a space in the traffic flow

Question: What rule should you use to judge a safe following distance in wet or frosty conditions if driving a car?
When driving on a road with lanes you must be able to stop in half the length of clear road you can see in front of you.
The bonnet of your vehicle lifts up while you are driving and you cannot see. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Turn your vehicle headlights on and look out of the side window
Brake smoothly and move over to the left side of the road
Steer your vehicle straight ahead and stop as quickly as you can
Speed up and move to the left side of the road

Question: What must you do if you intend to move your vehicle from the right-hand lane to the left-hand lane?

Answers.Answer: Move to the left as quickly as possible
Speed up and signal as you move to the left
Signal for at least 3 seconds before moving left
Slow down and signal as you move to the left
